page.title: 03First Year Humanities
page.content:
Following work done by 1st.Year Humanities last year,one of the local studies was urban geography.O-S maps obtained from the Technical Offices were 'scaled up' in order that groups of children might identify house types and building materials.This was considered important since local roadswere an extension of the Nash Estates built as part of the new Collier Row in 1938 and keeping to much the same style of building of building until 1948.
Children observed that with increased interest in D.I.Y. many tenants were changing the exterior fabric of their houses and building extensions.
